title: الْمُطَابَقَة الْمُتَقَدِّمَة
description: Learn advanced agreement rules in Arabic: agreement with collective nouns, غير وسوى, كلا وكلتا, and special cases in nominal vs. verbal sentences.

notes.title: Agreement Basics Review
content: الْمُطَابَقَة (agreement) means the verb, adjective, or pronoun matches its referent in gender and number. Basic rule: فِعْل agrees with فَاعِل, صِفَة agrees with مَوْصُوف.
However, there are many special cases in classical Arabic where agreement follows different patterns.

examples.english: The man came / The woman came
A generous man / A generous woman
The men came / The women came

notes.title: Agreement with Collective Nouns
content: اسم الجمع (collective noun) like قَوْم، نَاس، جَيْش can take singular or plural agreement. Singular treats it as a unit, plural treats it as individuals.
This gives flexibility: قَالَ الْقَوْمُ (as one entity) or قَالُوا الْقَوْمُ (as individuals).

examples.english: The people came and they said (as individuals)

notes.title: Agreement with غير وسوى
content: غَيْر and سِوَى take the gender/number of the مُسْتَثْنَى مِنْهُ (what is excepted from), not the مُسْتَثْنَى (exception) itself.
جَاءَ الطُّلَّابُ غَيْرُ فَاطِمَةَ - غَيْر is masculine (matching طُلَّاب) even though the exception is feminine.

examples.english: Female students came except Zayd (غير = fem?)
Men except Fatimah attended (siwaa follows men)

notes.title: Agreement with كلا وكلتا
content: كِلَا (both - masculine) and كِلْتَا (both - feminine) are dual in meaning but singular in form. They can take singular or dual agreement.
كِلَا الرَّجُلَيْنِ جَاءَ (singular) or جَاءَا (dual) - both are correct. Same for كِلْتَا.

examples.english: Both men are present (sing. or dual adj.)
Both women came (sing. or dual verb)
Both of them said (singular or dual)

notes.title: Verb-Subject Agreement Position
content: When verb precedes subject (الجملة الفعلية), verb is singular regardless of subject number: جَاءَ الطُّلَّابُ (not جاءوا الطُّلَّاب).
When subject precedes verb (الجملة الاسمية), verb agrees fully: الطُّلَّابُ جَاءُوا. This is a key rule in classical Arabic.

notes.title: Agreement with Broken Plurals
content: جمع التكسير for non-rational beings (animals, objects) typically takes feminine singular agreement: الْجِبَالُ شَاهِقَةٌ, الْكُتُبُ مُفِيدَةٌ.
For rational beings (humans), full plural agreement is used: الرِّجَالُ صَالِحُونَ.

exercises.prompt: اسْمُ الْجَمْعِ مِثْلُ «قَوْم» يَجُوزُ فِيهِ الْمُطَابَقَةُ _____ أَوِ الْجَمْعِيَّةُ
exercises.promptEn: Collective nouns like 'qawm' can take _____ or plural agreement

exercises.prompt: «كِلَا» وَ«كِلْتَا» يَجُوزُ فِيهِمَا الْمُطَابَقَةُ _____ أَوِ الْمُثَنَّاةُ
إِذَا تَقَدَّمَ الْفِعْلُ عَلَى الْفَاعِلِ يَكُونُ الْفِعْلُ _____ دَائِمًا
exercises.promptEn: When the verb precedes the subject, the verb is always _____

exercises.prompt: جَمْعُ التَّكْسِيرِ لِغَيْرِ الْعَاقِلِ يُعَامَلُ مُعَامَلَةَ الْمُؤَنَّثِ _____
exercises.promptEn: Broken plural for non-rational beings is treated as feminine _____
'The men came' - the verb here is _____ while the subject is plural
